result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan T. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan T. Larson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jordan T. Larson in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Defendant Jordan T. Larson in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:15
Michlig/Shawl/Court statement to sentencing
Court sentences to 6 months jail - CC with any other case - Costs  waived by court due to defendant facing WSP 
Appeal rights given
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:35 pm - Defendant Jordan T. Larson in court with attorney Richard J. Shawl.  Defendant Jordan T. Larson in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to Resist/Obstruct 946.41(1) - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Sentencing will be adjourned. Bail continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 28, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

10:21 am - Defendant Jordan T. Larson in court with attorney John E. Voorhees, appearing telephonically with leave of the court.  Defendant Jordan T. Larson in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Defendant states requesting appointment of new counsel.  Voorhees states appointment of new counsel in process.  Voorhees requests leave to withdraw.  Court will allow Voorhees to withdraw.  Court will need to await for appointment of new counsel prior to holding the preliminary hearing.  Court reviews prelim time with defendant and defendant wishes to proceed with appointment of new counsel.  Defendant states would like to revoke signed signature bond.  Court refers defendant to speak with new attorney.  Bail continued.

Defendant Jordan T. Larson in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern,Noelle Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  ATty MIchlig statement to court - states that he spoke with defendant's attorney and informed him that State's two witnesses were unavailable and would move for adjournment.  Michlig states thought defendant's Atty Voorhees would be here - but is unable to track him down.  Defendant statement to court- states left voicemail for Atty Voorhess asking Atty Voorhees to withdraw from his case and states reasons.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 10:15 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

01:22 pm - Defendant Jordan T. Larson in court, via video, in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Lawrence statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
